analyzed: iti vivṛtiḥ
translated: This is the exposition.

analyzed: vidhūta sakala vikalpa sat citta advaita sākṣāt karaṇam dhyānam sa ākāra vādi naḥ
translated: Meditation for us who advocate consciousness with images is the direct realization of the true non-duality of mind, free from all conceptual thoughts.

original: tad uktam yatra yatra mano yāti jñeye tatraiva yojayet /
analyzed: tat uktam yatra yatra manaḥ yāti jñeye tatra eva yojayet
translated: That is said: Wherever the mind goes to an object of knowledge, one should apply it right there.

original: calitvā yāsyate kutra sarvam eva hi tanmayam //
analyzed: calitvā yāsyate kutra sarvam eva hi tad mayam
translated: Having moved, where will it go? For everything is indeed full of that.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: śāta advaya acintya niṣprapañca nirābhāsa citta sākṣātkaraṇam dhyānam nirākāra vādinaḥ
translated: Meditation is the direct realization of the mind that is pleasant, non-dual, inconceivable, free from conceptual proliferation, and free from appearances, according to those who advocate the formless.

original: tathā ca rūpam asya mataṃ svacchaṃ nirākāraṃ nirañjanam /
analyzed: tathā ca rūpam asya matam su accham nirākāram nirañjanam
translated: And thus, his form is considered clear, formless, and passionless.

original: śakyaṃ tena na hi jñātum abuddhena kadācana //
analyzed: śakyam tena na hi jñātum abuddhena kadācana
translated: It is not possible for the unenlightened to ever know that.

original: vijñaptimātram evadam ity api hy upalambhataḥ /
analyzed: vijñapti mātram evadam iti api hi upalambhataḥ
translated: Even the thought this is mere representation is due to grasping.

analyzed: sthāpayan agratas kiñcid tanmātre na avatiṣṭhate
translated: By positing something in front, one does not abide in mere thatness.

original: yadā tv ālambanaṃ jñānaṃ naivopalabhate tadā /
analyzed: yadā tu ālambanam jñānam na eva upalabhate tadā
translated: But when knowledge does not perceive an object at all,

analyzed: sthitam vijñāna mātra tve grāhya abhāve tat agrahāt
translated: then it abides in mere consciousness, due to the absence of the object and the non-grasping of that.

original: paramārthasannityasākāravijñānasamādhau bhagavataḥ saṃsthitavedānta vādimatānupraveśaḥ /🔽sa hi paramārthasannityaṃ svacid rūpabrahmābhi
analyzed: sa hi paramārtha sat nityam sva cit rūpa brahma abhi
translated: In the concentration on ultimate reality, the formless consciousness, there is entry into the view of the established Vedantins.

analyzed: nna pariṇāma rūpam jagat icchati
translated: For he considers the world to be of the nature of the transformation of Brahman, the self-luminous form of ultimate reality, which is identified with Brahman.

original: tathā coktam yad yad vai dṛśyate kiñcit tat tat brahmeti kalpayet /
analyzed: tathā ca uktam yat yat vai dṛśyate kiñcid tat tat brahma iti kalpayet
translated: And thus it is said: Whatever is seen, one should consider that to be Brahman.

analyzed: tatas na anya gatam cittam brahmaṇi eva avatiṣṭhate
translated: Then the mind does not go elsewhere, but abides in Brahman alone.

analyzed: iti samāhi malam sa ākāra vādinaḥ
translated: Thus, the stain of concentration is for those who advocate the formless.

analyzed: evam nirākāra vādinā api nitya nirābhāsa niṣprapañca sva samvedana vijñāna bhāvanāyām bhāskara mata sthita vedāntavādi mata anupraveśa prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Thus, even one who advocates the formlessness of Brahman would have to enter the Vedanta doctrine of the sun, in the cultivation of the eternal, non-manifest, non-proliferating self-awareness of consciousness.

analyzed: saḥ pi vyapagata sakala nāma rūpa prapañca upaplava viśuddha prakāśa ānanda gha na nitya brahma abhyupagacchati
translated: He also accepts eternal Brahman, which is pure light, bliss, and non-dual, free from the disturbance of the proliferation of all names and forms.

original: bodhāmbhodhau mayi svacchaṃ tac chāyam viśvabuddhayaḥ /
analyzed: bodha ambhodhau mayi svaccham tat chāyam viśva buddhayaḥ
translated: The pure intellects of the universe are reflected in me, the ocean of consciousness.

original: udito vā pralīno vā na vikalpāya kalpate //
analyzed: uditaḥ vā pralīnaḥ vā na vikalpāya kalpate
translated: Whether it arises or dissolves, it does not lend itself to conceptualization.

analyzed: iti nirākāra vādinaḥ samādhi malam
translated: Thus, the formless doctrine is the stain of concentration.

analyzed: dṛṣṭiḥ anayoḥ pūrvavat
translated: The view of these two is as before.

analyzed: adhimātraḥ mādhyamikaḥ
translated: III. The great Madhyamika.

original: tatra māyopamādvayavādinaḥ vivṛtiḥ na san nāsan na sadasan na cāpy anubhayātmakam /
analyzed: tatra māyā upamā dvaya vādinaḥ vivṛtiḥ na sat na asat na sat asat na ca api anubhaya ātmakam
translated: There, the commentary on the doctrine of non-duality likened to an illusion: Not existent, not non-existent, not both existent and non-existent, nor even of the nature of neither.

analyzed: catuṣkoṭi vinirmuktam tattvam mādhyamikāḥ viduḥ
translated: The Madhyamikas know reality to be free from the four extremes.

analyzed: asya ca ayam arthaḥ  na sat bādhā yogāt
translated: And this is the meaning of that:🔽Not existent, because it is not subject to negation.

analyzed: asat api na ca ābhāsana vaśāt
translated: Not non-existent, because it appears.

original: tathā doṣād dvandvāt ubhayam api na /
analyzed: tathā doṣāt dvandvāt ubhayam api na
translated: Thus, both are not due to the duality of faults.

analyzed: nā api anubhayam tathā bodha abhāvāt iti
translated: Nor is it neither, because there is no such awareness.

original: api ca pūrvetaraparāmarśāt mūrtiś citre yathāvastuśakti skavāsaṅgaḥ / /
analyzed: api ca pūrva itara parāmarśāt mūrtiḥ citre yathāvastuśakti
translated: Moreover, due to the reference to the previous, the form is like a picture, the attachment to the power of the object as it is.

analyzed: sa hi māyā upamā devayā iti vivṛtiḥ
translated: The commentary says that this is indeed the non-dual like an illusion.

analyzed: asya eva ca māyā upama dvayasya bhāvanā dhyānam
translated: And the meditation is the cultivation of just this non-dual like an illusion.

analyzed: yaḥ tatra uccheda abhiniveśaḥ tat dhyāna malam
translated: The stain of meditation is the attachment to the cutting off there.

analyzed: māyā upamā dva ya adhimokṣataḥ ṣaṣ pāramitā paripūriṇī dṛṣṭiḥ
translated: The view that fulfills the six perfections is from the liberation of the non-dual like an illusion.

original: sarvadharmāpratiṣṭhānavādi nāṃ tv ayaṃ vicāraḥ na matam śāśvataṃ viśvaṃ na cocchedisamīhitam /
analyzed: sarva dharma apratiṣṭhāna vādi nām tu ayam vicāraḥ na matam śāśvatam viśvam na ca ucchedi samīhitam
translated: But for those who say that all dharmas are without foundation, this consideration is not accepted: The world is not considered eternal or subject to annihilation.

analyzed: śāśvata ucchedinaḥ yugmām na anubhayam vinā ubhayam
translated: The eternal and the annihilationist do not have both, nor do they not have both.

analyzed: a praṭiṣṭhāne vastu tattvam viduḥ buddhāḥ
translated: The Buddhas know the truth of things to be without foundation.

original: athaiṣā kalpanā naiva yac cid vetti na cittatām //
analyzed: athā eṣā kalpanā nā eva yat cit vetti na citta tām
translated: But this conception is not at all what is known as the nature of mind.

original: yo vit sarvasamāropaḥ sa sarvaḥ sarvathā na hi /
analyzed: yaḥ vid sarva samāropaḥ sa sarvaḥ sarvathā na hi
translated: All that is superimposed is all in every way.
The middle truth is without superimposition. How can there be the injunction of exclusion there?

original: anābhogaṃ hi yad jñānaṃ tac cāintyaṃ pracakṣate /
analyzed: an ābhogam hi yat jñānam tat ca aintyam pracakṣate
translated: For they declare that knowledge which is without effort to be endless.

original: sañcinti yad acintyaṃ vai tad acintyaṃ bhaven na hi //
analyzed: sañcinti yat acintyam vai tat acintyam bhavet na hi
translated: What is conceived as inconceivable is indeed not conceivable.

original: yenājātaṃ jagad buddhaṃ buddhiḥ śuddhaiva bodhataḥ /
analyzed: yena ajātam jagat buddham buddhiḥ śuddhā eva bodhataḥ
translated: By which the unborn world is known, and the intellect is purified by knowledge alone.

original: nijaṃ tasya jagat satyam anābhogena dhīmataḥ //
analyzed: nijam tasya jagat satyam anābhogena dhīmataḥ
translated: The world is real for him, through the effortless wisdom of the wise one.

original: tad uktam sarvāropavinirmukte svatas tattve cakāsati /
analyzed: tat uktam sarva āropa vinirmukte svatas tattve cakāsati
translated: As it is said: In the reality that is free from all superimpositions, which shines forth by itself,

analyzed: śūnyatā ādi abhidhānaiḥ tu tatra āropa nirākriyā
translated: The superimpositions are refuted by the designations such as emptiness and so on.

original: asya ca vicārāya āyātasya arthasya anāroparūpasya anabhiniveśavihāreṇa sākṣātkriyā dhyānaṃ /
analyzed: asya ca vicārāya āyātasya arthasya anāropa rūpasya anabhiniveśa vihāreṇa sākṣātkriyā dhyānam
translated: And the meditation is the direct realization of that meaning which has come for consideration, which is of the nature of non-superimposition, by the dwelling in non-attachment.
The obscuration to meditative concentration is the cutting off of all meaning and the state of dullness.

analyzed: an āropeṇa ṣaṣ pāramitā paripūraṇam dṛṣṭiḥ
translated: The view is the fulfillment of the six perfections by non-superimposition.

analyzed: iv atra mṛdu madhyayoḥ dharma avalambanā karuṇā
translated: Here, in the weak and medium [stages], compassion has the Dharma as its object.

original: dharmāvalam banā cānityatāvyasanasampātinaḥ sarvadharmān ālambya utpadyate yā sā boddhavyā /
analyzed: ca anitya tā vyasana sampātinaḥ sarva dharmān ālambya utpadyate yā sā boddhavyā
translated: And the compassion that has the Dharma as its object and is accompanied by the contemplation of impermanence arises by taking all dharmas as its object, and that should be understood.

original: abhimātrasya ca ālambananiḥsvabhāvā manaskāradharmā dhigamānālambanā karuṇā /
analyzed: abhimātrasya ca ālambana niḥsvabhāvāḥ manaskāra dharmāḥ dhigama an ālambanā karuṇā
translated: And in the great [stage], compassion has the realization of the absence of inherent nature in the object and the mental attention to the Dharma as its object.

analyzed: kāya traya vyavasthā ca asya maitreya nāthaiḥ uktā
translated: And the establishment of the three bodies of the Buddha is stated by Maitreyanatha.

original: tathā ca karoti yena citrāṇi hitāni jagataḥ samam /
analyzed: tathā ca karoti yena citrāṇi hitāni jagataḥ samam
translated: And he acts in such a way that he equally bestows various benefits upon the world.

original: ā bhavāt so'nupacchannaḥ kāyo nairmāṇiko muneḥ //
analyzed: ā bhavāt saḥ unupacchannaḥ kāyaḥ nairmāṇikaḥ muneḥ
translated: That body of the Sage is not concealed, up to the end of existence.

analyzed: dvātriṃśat lakṣaṇa aśīti vyañjana ātmā muneḥ ayam
translated: This one of the Sage, consisting of the thirty-two marks and eighty minor marks,

analyzed: sāmbhogikaḥ mataḥ kāyaḥ mahāyāna upabhogataḥ
translated: Is considered the enjoyment body, because it enjoys the Great Vehicle.

original: sarvākārāṃ viśuddhiṃ ye dharmāḥ prāptā nirāsravāḥ /
analyzed: sarva ākārām viśuddhim ye dharmāḥ prāptāḥ nirāsravāḥ
translated: Those dharmas that have attained purification in all aspects, being free from outflows,

analyzed: svābhāvikaḥ muneḥ kāyaḥ teṣām prakṛti lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Are the intrinsic nature body of the Sage, characterized by their nature.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: mantra nayaḥ
translated: The method of mantras

original: mantranayas tu asmābhir ihātigambhīratvād gambhīranayādhimuktika puruṣaviṣayatvāt caturmudrādisādhanaprakāśanavistaratvāc ca na vyāk riyate
analyzed: mantra nayaḥ tu asmābhiḥ iha ati gambhīra tvāt gambhīra naya adhimuktika puruṣa viṣaya tvāt catur mudrā ādi sādhana prakāśana vistara tvāt ca na vyāk riyate
translated: However, the method of mantras is not explained by us here because it is extremely profound, because it is the domain of men who are devoted to the profound method, and because it is extensively revealed in the practice of the four seals and so on.

original: tathā ca ekārthatve'py asaṃmohāt bahūpāyād aduṣkarāt /
analyzed: tathā ca eka artha tve pi asaṃmohāt bahu upāyāt a duṣkarāt
translated: And thus, even when the meaning is the same, because of non-confusion, because of many means, because of being not difficult,

analyzed: tīkṣṇa indriya adhikārāt ca mantra śāstram viśiṣyate
translated: And because of being for those with sharp faculties, the science of mantras is distinguished.

original: kṛtaś cāsmābhir atra sekanirṇayo nāma granthaḥ /
analyzed: kṛtaḥ ca asmābhiḥ atra sekanirṇayaḥ nāma granthaḥ
translated: And a treatise called Sekanirnaya has been composed by us here.

original: avasānaṃ nanu yadi mahāyānanirṇīta evārthaḥ paramārtho'sti atra kim arthaṃ tarhi śrāvakapratyekabuddhayāne bhagavān deśitavān /
analyzed: avasānam nanu yadi mahāyāna nirṇītaḥ evā arthaḥ parama arthaḥ usti atra kim artham tarhi śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yāne bhagavān deśitavān
translated: If indeed the ultimate meaning is determined only in the Great Vehicle, then why did the Blessed One teach it in the Vehicle of the Disciples and Solitary Buddhas?

analyzed: tat na
translated: That is not so.

analyzed: mahāyāna prāpya prāpana artham eva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yāna sopānayoḥ nirmāṇāt
translated: Because the vehicles of the hearers and solitary realizers were created as steps for attaining the Great Vehicle itself.

analyzed: tat uktam ādhikarmika sattvasya paramārtha avatāraṇe
translated: This is stated in the context of introducing beings who are beginners to the ultimate truth.

original: upāyas tv ayaṃ sambuddhaiḥ sopānam iva nirmitaḥ //
analyzed: upāyaḥ tu ayam sambuddhaiḥ sopānam iva nirmitaḥ
translated: But this method was created by the fully enlightened ones, like a staircase.

original: saddharmapuṇḍarīke'py uktam ekaṃ tu yānaṃ hi nayaś ca eka ekā ciyaṃ deśana nāyakānāṃ /
analyzed: saddharmapuṇḍarīke pi uktam ekam tu yānam hi nayaḥ ca ekaḥ ekā nāyakānām
translated: It is also said in the Lotus Sutra: There is only one vehicle, one way. This is the teaching of the guides.

original: upāyakauśalya mamaivarūpaṃ yat trīṇi yānāny upadarśayāmi //
analyzed: upāya kauśalya mama eva rūpam yat trīṇi yānāni upadarśayāmi
translated: This is the skillful means of mine alone, that I show three vehicles.

original: nāgārjunapādair apy uktam dharmadhātor asaṃbhedād dhyānabhedo'sti na prabho /
analyzed: nāgārjuna pādaiḥ api uktam dharmadhātoḥ asaṃbhedāt dhyāna bhedaḥ usti na prabho
translated: It is also said by the feet of Nagarjuna: Because the dharma realm is indivisible, O Lord, there is no division in meditation.

analyzed: yāna tritayam ākhyātam tvayā sattva avatārataḥ
translated: The three vehicles are taught by you for the sake of introducing beings.

original: anyatrāpy uktam muktis tu śūnyatādṛṣṭis tadarthāśeṣabhāvaṇā /
translated: It is also said elsewhere: Liberation is the view of emptiness, and the meditation on that is the remainder.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: idaṃ ca yānatritayaprakāśanaṃ manyamānaśūnyatā saiva bhagavato 'vagantavyaḥ /
analyzed: idam ca yāna tritaya prakāśanam manyamāna śūnyatā sā eva bhagavataḥ vagantavyaḥ
translated: And this teaching of the three vehicles should be understood as the emptiness of the Blessed One, which is accepted as such.

original: tathāhi nodāhṛtaṃ tvayā kiñcid ekam apy akṣaraṃ vibho /
analyzed: tathā hi nā udāhṛtam tvayā kiñcid ekam api akṣaram vibho
translated: For thus it is not said by you, O Lord, even a single syllable.

analyzed: kṛtsnaḥ ca vaineya janaḥ dharma varṣana tarpitaḥ
translated: And the entire retinue is satisfied by the rain of Dharma.

analyzed: cintāmaṇiḥ iva akampyaḥ sarva saṅkalpa vāyubhiḥ
translated: Like a wish-fulfilling gem, unshaken by all the winds of imagination,

analyzed: tathā api sarva sattvānām aśeṣa āśā prapūrakaḥ
translated: yet fulfilling all the wishes of all beings without exception.

analyzed: cakra bhramaṇa yogena nirvikalpe api tāyinaḥ
translated: Even in the non-conceptual state of the Protector, by the yoga of the spinning wheel,

original: sambhāro vedhasāmarthyāt deśanā sampravartate //🔽yānānāṃ nāsti vai niṣṭhā yāvac cittaṃ pravartate /
analyzed: sambhāraḥ vedha sāmarthyāt deśanā sampravartate  yānānām na asti vai niṣṭhā yāvat cittam pravartate
translated: the teaching proceeds, by the power of the creator's accumulation.🔽As long as the mind proceeds, there is no end to the vehicles;

original: parāvṛtte tu vai citte na yānaṃ nāpi yāyinaḥ //
analyzed: parāvṛtte tu vai citte na yānam na api yāyinaḥ
translated: but when the mind is turned around, there are no vehicles and no travelers.

analyzed: saddharma ratna ghaṭikā vāc hi atra grathitā amalā
translated: Here, the pure speech is woven into the jewel casket of the true Dharma,

analyzed: hṛdaye kriyatām dhīrāḥ tattva ratnāvalī mude
translated: O wise ones, make the garland of the jewel of reality in your heart for joy.

analyzed: saṃgrahe tu priya tvena vistara dveṣiṇā mayā
translated: But by me, who dislikes elaboration out of love for the compendium,

original: bhūrir anuttame tasmin kṣantavyo vistarapriyaḥ //🔽vidhāya bhavyārthanāyaprayatnād imaṃ mayā grantham anuttarā rtham /
analyzed: bhūriḥ anuttame tasmin kṣantavyaḥ vistara priyaḥ  vidhāya bhavya artha nāya prayatnāt imam mayā grantham
translated: the extensive one who loves elaboration should be forgiven in that unsurpassed one.🔽Having made this unsurpassed text with effort for the sake of those who are worthy,

original: ālambhi yat puṇyam anena lokas tathāgatatvaṃ labhatām alabhyam //
analyzed: ālambhi yat puṇyam anena lokaḥ tathāgata tvam labhatām a labhyam
translated: may the world attain the unattainable state of a Tathāgata through whatever merit has been obtained by me through this.
The Garland of the Jewel of Reality is completed.

analyzed: kṛtiḥ iyam paṇḍita avadhūta advaya vajra pādānām
translated: This is the work of the learned Avadhūta Advayavajra.
